alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Northern Bristol; Suffolk; Western Norfolk; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 3:06PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Norfolk, southeastern Suffolk, northern Plymouth and northern Bristol Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 306 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Randolph, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Urban and poor drainage flooding possible in localized downpours. Locations impacted include... Boston, Brockton, Quincy, Weymouth, Braintree, Randolph, Milton, Stoughton, Marshfield, Easton, Hingham, Canton, Scituate, Pembroke, Rockland, Abington, Duxbury, Whitman, Hanover and East Bridgewater. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Northern Bristol; Suffolk; Western Norfolk; Western Plymouth
